abstracts.cdata!:
The program supports the consolidation
            of a suitable medium-term framework in which structural
            reform, coupled with debt and debt service reduction, can be
            implemented in a growth-oriented manner. The program
            addresses those areas which are considered essential for
            integrating all regions of the Philippine economy with the
            rest of the world. These include: (a) macroeconomic
            management through improvement of Central Bank finances and
            appropriate energy pricing policies; (b) promotion of
            investment through implementation of a new foreign
            investment act, privatization and encouragement of private
            participation in infrastructure projects; (c)
            rationalization of the tariff regime and removal of
            quantitative restrictions on imports; (d) introduction of
            greater competition into land and sea transport; and (e)
            removal of restrictions on foreign exchange transactions on
            both the current and capital accounts. The loan will finance
            general imports of goods at a time when foreign reserves are
            being reduced by the needs of the debt and debt service
            reduction operation and an incipient investment recovery.
